migration.intro: Law of the Visigoths first promulgated by king Chindasuinth
migration.description: Enables farms and settlers and manorial court and two field system

merovingian.intro: Hops first cultivated

carolingian.intro: Three-field crop rotation system in use in medieval Europe

viking.intro: Pippin I of Aquitaine issues a land register

ottonian.intro: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus sponsors the Geoponica
ottonian.description: Enables construction of cortijo and granges and improves agricultural yield of corvee

romanesque.intro: Henry III the Black marries Agnes of Poitou at the Imperial Palace
romanesque.description: Enables great halls and expands palatial construction

norman.intro: Robert of Molesme founds Citeaux Abbey

gothic.intro: Hamelin rebuilts Conisbrough castle
gothic.description: Enables upstairs rooms such as solars

rayonnant.intro: Teutonic Order absorbs the Livonian Brothers of the Sword
rayonnant.description: Enables parlour rooms and expands diplomatic actions available

flamboyant.description: Enables custumal and expands legal actions and tenures available

italian.intro: The Medici Family are made official bankers of the Papacy

maritime.intro: John IV of Katzenelnbogen plants Riesling

merovingian.intro: Panemone Mill spreads from Sistan

carolingian.intro: Large scale gristmills spreads from the islamic world

viking.intro: Al-Kindi compiles his book on distillation

ottonian.intro: Spread of the Catalan Forge
ottonian.description: Improves iron yield from mines and improves blades production

romanesque.intro: Post mill invented in Flanders

norman.intro: Abbey of Fontenay constructs a forge

gothic.intro: Augsburg craft guilds are organized

rayonnant.intro: Florence guilds are reorganized

flamboyant.intro: Water powered paper mill established in Aragon
flamboyant.description: Enables paper and cheapens book production

italian.intro: Maiolica workshops spread in Tuscany

maritime.intro: Jan van Eyck completes his Portrait of a Man

migration.description: Enables trade and merchants and taverns and guilds

merovingian.intro: Great Berber Revolt commences

carolingian.intro: Berbers found Sijilmasa as an Sahara route entrepot
carolingian.description: Enables roadside inns and sugar plantations

viking.intro: Horse collar in use in medieval Europe
viking.description: Improves agricultural yield and enables wagons

ottonian.intro: King Lothair III captures many cities in Flanders
ottonian.description: Enables mayor and expands available borough actions

romanesque.intro: Multi level and fortified granaries appear

norman.intro: Visby merchants establish Gutagard at Novgorod

gothic.intro: Chancery commences to keep the Charter Rolls
gothic.description: Enables charters for communities and guilds and corporations and fairs

rayonnant.intro: Copenhagen receives its city charter
rayonnant.description: Expands available borough actions and improves borough actions

italian.intro: Ciompi wool carders revolt occurs in Florence
italian.description: Expands available borough actions and improves borough actions

maritime.intro: Kocs inhabitants make wagons for the daughter of King Zsigmond

merovingian.intro: Ecgbert of York receives the pallium from pope Gregory III

carolingian.intro: Charlemagne appoints Alcuin as advisor

viking.intro: Al-Khwarizmi compiles his Book on Calculations

ottonian.intro: Dunstan teaches at a cathedral school
ottonian.description: Enables cathedral school and monastic school

romanesque.intro: Anselm of Canterbury becomes abbot of Bec

norman.intro: Guild of students found the university of Bologna

gothic.intro: Herrad of Landsberg completes her Hortus Deliciarum

rayonnant.intro: Thomas Aquinas completes his Summa Theologica

flamboyant.intro: Pope Clement V moves Curia to Avignon

italian.intro: Reconstruction of the Basilica of San Lorenzo in Florence

maritime.intro: The council of Basil is convoked

merovingian.intro: The Scaet is reissued

carolingian.intro: The Denier is introduced

viking.intro: First Danegeld raised in Frisia

ottonian.intro: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus compiles De Administrando Imperio

romanesque.intro: The monk Hemming commences a cartulary

gothic.intro: Cahorsins are present at the Champagne Fairs
gothic.description: Expands trade actions and improves fairs effect

rayonnant.intro: First minting of the Florin
rayonnant.description: Expands trade actions and improves fairs effect

flamboyant.intro: The Farolfi firm from Florence employs Amatino Manucci

italian.intro: Gabelle introduced by the court of Tortosa

maritime.intro: Murad II blockades Thessalonica

merovingian.intro: Constantine V marries Tzitzak

carolingian.intro: Andalusian merchants set up an emporium

viking.intro: Ziryab introduces velvet to Al-Andalus

ottonian.intro: Horizontal Loom in use in medieval Europe

romanesque.intro: Spinning wheel invented in the Islamic world
romanesque.description: Improves yield of wool and cotton

norman.intro: Anselm of Baggio is appointed bishop of Lucca

gothic.intro: Surcoat is in use

rayonnant.intro: Matthew Paris records that Henry III of England has a baldachin

flamboyant.description: Improves luxury yield of fabric and enables tabard

italian.intro: Philip the Bold of Burgundy orders tapestries from Paris

maritime.intro: Cassone in use
maritime.description: Improves remains of wedding duty and enables cassone

migration.description: Enables levies and feudal tenures and banalities

merovingian.intro: Odilo of Bavaria vassalizes Carantania

carolingian.intro: The Capitulary of Herstal is issued

viking.intro: Spanish March is established as a buffer zone

ottonian.intro: German nobles elect Henry the Fowler

romanesque.intro: Baldwin IV of Flanders institutes castellanies
romanesque.description: Enables castellany land unit and enables hoarding architecture

norman.description: Enables heraldic devices and herald settlers

gothic.intro: King Henry II appoints Thomas Becket

rayonnant.intro: System of baillies established in France

italian.intro: Sempacherbrief as a contract or Pfaffenbrief is signed

maritime.intro: Philip III the Good appoints Lannoy as captain general

migration.intro: Stirrup introduced into Europe by the Avars

merovingian.intro: Merovingians maintain a horse breeding centre

carolingian.intro: Pepin the Short defeats Aistulf

viking.intro: Hungarians victorious in the first battle of Lechfeld

ottonian.intro: Al-Mansur sacks Barcelona

romanesque.intro: Tughril conquers Nishapur and Merv
romanesque.description: Improves cavalry charge and improves turkic sword cavalry

gothic.intro: Saladin captures Hugh II of Saint Omer
gothic.description: Enables chivalric guild and enables muntator

rayonnant.intro: Edward I of England invades Wales and Llywelyn surrenders

italian.intro: Rowel spurs in use in medieval Europe

maritime.intro: Charles VII of France issues an ordinance at Orleans

migration.intro: Lombards introduce the helm into Europe

merovingian.intro: Alfonso I of Asturias establishes the Kingdom of Galicia

carolingian.intro: Charlemagne launches a campaign against the Saxons

viking.intro: Varangians settle in Novgorod under the leadership of Rurik

ottonian.intro: Vikings sail to England and demand Danegeld

romanesque.intro: Yaroslav the Wise becomes grand prince of Kiev

gothic.intro: Henry the Lion submits to Frederick I

rayonnant.intro: Ferdinand III the Saint besieges Cordoba

italian.intro: Gianfrancesco I Gonzaga inherits the rule of Mantua

maritime.intro: Visconti of Milan captures Malatesta of Florence at Zagonara

merovingian.intro: Charles Martel commences a campaign against the Saxons

carolingian.intro: Harun al-Rashid ascends the throne

viking.intro: Vikings sack Monkwearmouth

ottonian.intro: Otto I the Great appoints Gero as margrave of Merseburg

romanesque.intro: Ethelnoth of Canterbury sponsors the Harley Psalter

norman.intro: Yusuf ibn Tashfin launches expedition in Al-Andalus

gothic.intro: German fraternity founds the Teutonic Order

rayonnant.intro: Mongols besiege Esztergom

italian.intro: Treaty of Tagilde is signed

maritime.intro: Plate armor in use in medieval Europe

merovingian.intro: Charles Martel defeats Poppo at the battle of the Boarn

carolingian.intro: Charlemagne launches military campaign against Aquitaine

viking.intro: Tactica treatise is completed
viking.description: Expands tactial actions such as shield wall and flying wedge

ottonian.intro: Spread of Damask Steel

romanesque.intro: Otto III gifts swords to the convent of Essen

norman.intro: William the Conqueror assembles a fleet in readiness for an invasion

gothic.intro: Raymond II is assassinated

rayonnant.intro: Charles I of Anjou defeats Manfred of Sicily at the Battle of Benevento

flamboyant.intro: Johannes Lichtenauer completes his combat manual

italian.intro: Archibald Douglas clashes with the English at Nesbit Moor

maritime.intro: Joan of Arc enters Orleans with a relief expedition

merovingian.intro: Charles Martel invades Bavaria

carolingian.intro: Pepin the Short launches a campaign in Septimania

viking.intro: Viking assault on the island of Lindisfarne

ottonian.intro: Battle of Andrassos

romanesque.intro: Count of Anjou defeats the forces of Conan I of Brittany

gothic.intro: Abbey of Cluny mentions Brabancon mercenaries

rayonnant.intro: Alexander Nevsky routs the Swedes

flamboyant.intro: Flemish militia are victorious in the Battle of the Golden Spurs

italian.intro: Vytautas the Great defeats the Teutonic Order at Grunwald

maritime.intro: Charles VII of France invades Normandy during the Hundred Years War

merovingian.intro: Grenades appear after the reign of Leo III

carolingian.intro: Charlemagne besieges Pavia

viking.intro: Fire archers in use

ottonian.intro: Crossbow used during the siege of Senlis

romanesque.intro: Seljuks defeat the Ghaznavids at the battle of Dandanaqan

norman.intro: Florence conquers the neighboring city of Montecascioli

gothic.intro: Kwarezmian forces capture Tiblisi

rayonnant.intro: The Barons War commences

italian.intro: Janissary corps incorporates handguns

maritime.intro: John Hunyadi is victorious at Semendria

merovingian.intro: Scandinavians found Ladoga
merovingian.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

carolingian.intro: Danes found Hedeby

viking.intro: Charlemagne issues Limits on Passage of Merchants

ottonian.intro: Byzantine Chelandions repel the Rus fleet with Greek Fire
ottonian.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

romanesque.intro: Count of Holland defeats an imperial army at the Battle of Vlaardingen

gothic.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

rayonnant.intro: Carta Pisana is made
rayonnant.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

flamboyant.intro: Larger Caravels in use in the Bay of Biscay
flamboyant.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

italian.intro: Grace Dieu is launched
italian.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

maritime.intro: Diogo de Silves discovers the Azores
maritime.description: Improves sailing and expands ship types

migration.intro: Moors introduce the lute into Andalusia
migration.description: Enables minstrels and feasts and revelry

merovingian.intro: Gregorian Chant is introduced

carolingian.intro: Roland killed at the battle of Roncevaux
carolingian.description: Improves revelry from feasts and improves minstrels effects

viking.intro: Tropes are developed

ottonian.intro: Greek Anthology is recompiled

romanesque.intro: Ibn Sina completes his Treatise on Love
romanesque.description: Improves revelry from feasts and revelry from troubadours

gothic.intro: Hildegard of Bingen completes her Ordo Virtutum

rayonnant.intro: William completes his Reynard the Fox

flamboyant.intro: Alfonso X the Wise completes his Book of Games

italian.intro: Geoffrey Chaucer commences his Canterbury Tales

maritime.intro: First Chamber of Rhetoric establishes in Bruges

migration.description: Enables tournaments and hunts and fairs

merovingian.intro: Ethelbert II of Kent requests two goshawks for hunting from Boniface

carolingian.intro: Pope Stephen II crosses the Alps to anoint Pepin the Short

viking.intro: Louis and Charles hold military games at Worms

ottonian.intro: Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus compiles De Ceremoniis

romanesque.intro: Bremen gains the right to hold a fair
romanesque.description: Improves revelry from fairs and expands fairs actions

norman.intro: William IX of Aquitaine composes a lyric on returning from the crusade

gothic.intro: Count of Champagne guarantees protection of merchants
gothic.description: Improves revelry from fairs and expands fairs actions

rayonnant.intro: War of the Cow erupts after a peasant stole a cow during a joust
rayonnant.description: Improves revelry from jousts and expands joust actions

flamboyant.description: Improves revelry from jousts and expands joust actions

maritime.intro: Philip the Good marries Isabel of Portugal

merovingian.intro: Tower house introduced in Navarre

carolingian.intro: Franks besiege Narbonne

viking.intro: Robert the Strong is appointed count of Anjou

ottonian.intro: Abd ar-Rahman III completes the Medina Azahara

romanesque.intro: Hugh Capet drives Odo I of Blois out of Melun

gothic.intro: Patrick of Salisbury is ambushed at Poitiers

flamboyant.intro: Tver city wall and kremlin is constructed

italian.intro: Buda fortress is remodeled with kill zones

maritime.intro: Hussites construct Sion castle

merovingian.intro: Sturm founds the Abbey of Fulda

viking.intro: Second Byzantine Iconoclasm ends

romanesque.intro: Trdat commences construction of the cathedral of Ani

norman.intro: Abbey of Saint Denis commences construction

gothic.intro: Abbey of Saint Denis completes construction of its choir

rayonnant.intro: Reims cathedral completes its choir

flamboyant.intro: Gloucester Cathedral completes construction of its cloisters

maritime.intro: Brunelleschi commences construction of the dome of Santa Maria del Fiore

ottonian.intro: Siege of Chandax

italian.intro: Couillard technique spreads

maritime.intro: Paris is recaptured by the English

migration.description: Enables libraries and books and chronicles

carolingian.intro: Cancor founds Lorsch Abbey

ottonian.intro: Widukind completes his Deeds of the Saxons

romanesque.intro: Ethelnoth of Canterbury sponsors the Harley Psalter

gothic.intro: Eike of Repgow compiles the Saxon Mirror

rayonnant.intro: Matthew Paris completes his Chronica Majora

maritime.intro: Gutenberg invents moveable type printing

carolingian.intro: Charlemagne confirms the Donation of Pepin

viking.intro: Al-Razi becomes director of a hospital in Baghdad

romanesque.intro: Ibn Sina completes his Canon of Medicine

gothic.intro: Barons Crusade commences

rayonnant.intro: Second Council of Lyon establishes major mendicant orders

flamboyant.intro: Duccio completes his Madonna and Child
